step.title: Commit Granularity Decision
step.critical: Decide commit granularity based on task complexity

rule.name: task-level
rule.condition: Task has 1-3 subtasks OR subtasks are tightly coupled
rule.action: Commit at TASK level (all subtasks in one commit)
rule.rationale: Keeps related changes together for easier review

rule.name: subtask-level
rule.condition: Task has 4+ subtasks OR subtasks are independent
rule.action: Commit at SUBTASK level (one commit per subtask)
rule.rationale: Allows granular review of distinct changes

rule.name: logical-grouping
rule.condition: Multiple subtasks form a logical unit
rule.action: Group related subtasks in one commit

anti-patterns.avoid: Mixing unrelated changes in one commit
Commits that break the build or tests

pr-alignment.principle: Commits within a PR should tell a coherent story
Each commit should be reviewable in isolation
Commit order should reflect logical implementation flow
PR reviewers can understand the feature by reading commits sequentially
